column5: On foot of my call last night during the Private Members' motion for the possible creation of 240 jobs, albeit 60 fewer than Michael O'Leary's, I raised the matter with the Minister for Community, Rural and Gaeltacht Affair, Deputy Ó Cuív.  Has he been in touch with the Tánaiste since then with regard to those potential jobs?  This does not require legislation, only a couple of telephone calls.  The problem with this House, and the Ceann Comhairle can ask me which——
It is not a local constituency matter.  We are talking about 240 jobs.  I am asking the Tánaiste——
I am looking for a "Yes" or "No" answer.
I will take that as a "No".
